column4: Can someone take a look at this http://paste.ubuntu.com/91282/ Its the dmesg from plugging in a USB and it mounting almost a minute later,
you can use wine to run a windows app, should work
bad cable to your fine new mobile phone? the I/O errors are not a good sign. either the cable or the drive in the mobile (or even your USB port) is not well behaving
Its the same with every USB device on this machine
every usb port too, doubt its hardware
front side USB port? try one on the back side
works the same either way
hm. maybe a hardware defect of the USB controller then. or some weird BIOS setting confusing the hardware (bus speed for example).
doh! Well ill check bios
nothing in the bios is set wrong
well if absolutely no usb device works, even if you boot with the live cd. i'd suspect a hardware issue
they work just mount REALLY slow
well, the i/O errors you've shown in the dmesg would make me nervous
Happening since 8.04
no HW has failed yet.. so... im assuming its Software related.
you could try booting with "noapic"
kk brb
noapic or noacpi ?
eh, still slow mounting, tried noapic and noacpi
i won't have good ideas anymore.. you could try older kernels (oldl live cd) again to check if it's really a software issue as you suspect older versions worked better
eh, its not really an issue, just annoying
wh not packages.ubuntu.com? ;-)
It has links to ubuntu wiki
ok, that site doesn't look bad. and it seems to check your OS (browser header) :-)
